bug.author: zhoonit
bug.summary: Running test failed possibly due to tensorflow
bug.description:
Clean build && test on latest commit fails. It might be due to tensorflow version. <denchmark-h:h1>Issue Description</denchmark-h>
A clear and concise description of what the bug is. <denchmark-h:h1>TEST OUTPUT</denchmark-h>
5/7 unittest_cppfilter TIMEOUT 30.009958744049072 s test-logs.txt <denchmark-code>... [libprotobuf ERROR external/protobuf_archive/src/google/protobuf/descriptor_database.cc:58] File already exists in database: tensorflow/contrib/tpu/proto/tpu_embedding_configuration.proto [libprotobuf FATAL external/protobuf_archive/src/google/protobuf/descriptor.cc:1358] CHECK failed: GeneratedDatabase()->Add(encoded_file_descriptor, size): terminate called after throwing an instance of 'google::protobuf::FatalException' what(): CHECK failed: GeneratedDatabase()->Add(encoded_file_descriptor, size): ... /* for several times */ </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h1>How to Reproduce</denchmark-h>
$ rm -rf build $ meson --prefix=${NNST_ROOT} --sysconfdir=${NNST_ROOT} --libdir=lib --bindir=bin --includedir=include build $ ninja -C build test <denchmark-h:h1>Further Information</denchmark-h>
A link to an output result showing the issue Exact OS version
tested on Ubuntu 16.04 running on docker. <denchmark-h:h2>installation</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>echo "Install nnstreamer dependencies"
$ apt-get install -y \ liborc-0.4-0 \ liborc-0.4-0-dbg \ liborc-0.4-dev \ liborc-0.4-doc \ libopencv-dev \ libpng-dev \ libgtest-dev \
$ apt-get install -y software-properties-common $ add-apt-repository -y ppa:nnstreamer/ppa $ apt-get update $ apt-get install -y ssat tensorflow-dev tensorflow-lite-dev libprotobuf-dev
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>version info</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>$ apt-get install -y ssat tensorflow-dev tensorflow-lite-dev libprotobuf-dev Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree Reading state information... Done Note, selecting 'tensorflow-c-dev' instead of 'tensorflow-dev' libprotobuf-dev is already the newest version (3.6.1-0~201910040852~ubuntu16.04.1). ssat is already the newest version (1.1.0-0~202003161038~ubuntu16.04.1). tensorflow-c-dev is already the newest version (1.13.1-0~201909160649~ubuntu16.04.1). tensorflow-lite-dev is already the newest version (1.13.1-0~201909160649~ubuntu16.04.1). 0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 3 not upgraded. </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/2293>#2293</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.

Uh... we've been not testing tensorflow (non-lite) for a while. After fixing this, we will need to add related test into CI/Ubuntu test case. (enable tensorflow-test in pdebuild). Or if this takes too much time in CI build, add a daily build/test item.

$ mv /nnstreamer.git ~/nnstreamer.git somehow solved the issue but still having segmentation fault. I will look into it with valgrind. <denchmark-code>1/7 unittest_common OK 0.011839866638183594 s 2/7 unittest_sink FAIL 20.981858253479004 s (killed by signal 11 SIGSEGV) 3/7 unittest_plugins FAIL 0.8270978927612305 s (killed by signal 11 SIGSEGV) 4/7 unittest_src_iio FAIL 1.9776215553283691 s (killed by signal 11 SIGSEGV) 5/7 unittest_cppfilter OK 1.2273647785186768 s 6/7 unittest_tizen_custom OK 0.009969472885131836 s 7/7 unittest_tizen_custom-set OK 0.014062643051147461 s </denchmark-code>
